title: A Random Walk Down Wall Street
author: Burton G. Malkiel
description: Explains how markets are efficient and why index funds make sense.

title: Common Stocks and Uncommon Profits
author: Philip Fisher
description: Philip Fisher’s timeless lessons on growth stock investing.

title: Essays of Warren Buffett
author: Warren Buffett
description: Key shareholder letters curated by Buffett himself.

title: Flash Boys
author: Michael Lewis
description: A look into high-frequency trading and market manipulation.

title: Little Book of Common Sense Investing
author: John C. Bogle
description: Jack Bogle on why indexing wins over active management.

title: Market Wizards
author: Jack D. Schwager
description: Interviews with legendary traders and their strategies.

title: One Up On Wall Street
author: Peter Lynch
description: Peter Lynch on spotting investment opportunities in plain sight.

title: Principles: Life and Work
author: Ray Dalio
description: Ray Dalio shares the principles that shaped Bridgewater.

title: Reminiscences of a Stock Operator
author: Edwin Lefèvre
description: A semi-autobiographical story of a legendary speculator.

title: The Alchemy of Finance
author: George Soros
description: George Soros explains reflexivity and market behavior.

title: The Intelligent Investor
author: Benjamin Graham
description: Benjamin Graham’s guide to value investing.

title: The Psychology of Money
author: Morgan Housel
description: Morgan Housel explains the behavioral side of finance.

title: Unshakeable
author: Tony Robbins
description: Tony Robbins' strategies for building long-term wealth.
